cluster_relations.rel_desc: Social media fundamentally transforms human communication in contemporary society.

cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Denotes that the subject exerts a causal or shaping effect on the object (e.g., social media influencing communication, relationships, behaviors, or perceptions).

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject causes a fundamental change in the nature, structure, or mode of operation of the object.
args.justification: This relation has the same domain-specific semantics as the other instances (social media's impact on aspects of human communication and society) and should share the same relation class and CAUSALITY group for schema consistency. It legitimately remains a stronger predicate ('transforms') than the more generic 'influences', so only the class and group are aligned.
